RankDef.description: A free citizen of the Empire with basic rights and protections under Imperial law, but no noble title or lands.
A citizen who has earned recognition for service or achievement, holding slightly elevated status within Imperial society.
The lowest rank of nobility, often granted for exceptional service to the Empire or significant contributions to society.
A warrior noble sworn to serve the Empire, granted lands and titles in exchange for military service and loyalty to the Crown.
A hereditary knight with a small estate, representing the transition between knighthood and the higher nobility.
A lord or lady with jurisdiction over a barony, responsible for local governance and justice within their domain.
A noble ranking between Baron and Earl, often serving as deputies to higher-ranking nobles in their administrative duties.
A high-ranking noble with authority over an earldom, wielding significant political influence and commanding substantial resources.
A border noble responsible for defending the Empire's frontier regions, granted extensive military and administrative powers.
One of the highest-ranking nobles in the Empire, ruling over a duchy with near-autonomous authority under the Emperor.
A supreme noble ranking just below the imperial family, often ruling multiple duchies or serving as regional governors.
A member of the imperial family or one granted the title by the Emperor, possessing royal blood or equivalent status.
The supreme ruler of the Empire, wielding absolute authority over all Imperial territories and commanding the loyalty of all subjects.
A trusted advisor to the imperial court, possessing significant influence over imperial policy regardless of hereditary rank.
The chief administrator of the Empire, responsible for coordinating imperial policy and serving as the Emperor's right hand in governance.
